column4: hi i need help. i want to prevent certain processes from starting up during system boot.
how do i control what processes should be run at boot time?
i don't want to start processes like apache and mysqld on boot up
so how do i stop that?
Do you need apache and mysql?
no i don't need them. i want to start them manually when i require them.
Is there a link to mysql.server in /etc/rc2.d ?
there was a utility right? u could choose what stuff rc2 started?
I wouldn't know, I don't use graphical interfaces.
no no a command line utlility i can't seem to get the name
Nor do I use commapnd line utilities
I'm asking if there is a symolbic link to mysql in your /etc/rc2.d
yes there is
but this is not the right way to remove it
This is why it is being started up at bot.
By what convention?
u have to keep hunting
What?
http://nixcraft.com/shell-scripting/542-ubuntu-linux-control-startup-services-scripts.html
update-rc.d that's what i was looking for
it removes all links
